identificationModule.briefTitle: Study in Adults With Severe Chronic Rhinosinusitis With Nasal Polyposis Treated With Dupilumab in France
identificationModule.officialTitle: Observational Study in Adults With Severe Chronic Rhinosinusitis With Nasal Polyposis (CRSwNP) Treated With Dupilumab in France

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a multicentre, non-interventional, single arm study that aims to describe the treatment patterns in France: patients' characteristics, disease characteristics, prior treatments for Severe chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis and treatment prescription modalities. As well as to assess the clinical outcome after initiation of dupilumab (Dupixent®) and safety of the product during the two years of treatment

armGroups.label: Dupilumab
armGroups.description: The information will be collected during consultation as part of the patient's usual follow-up.

interventions.name: Dupilumab
interventions.description: This study will not administer any treatment, only observe the treatment as prescribed in real world-clinical practice.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Patient characteristics: Age
Patient characteristics: Sex
Patient characteristics: Weight
Patient characteristics: Height
Patient characteristics: Type 2 comorbidities
primaryOutcomes.description: The following patient characteristics will be described: Documented comorbidities associated with type 2 inflammation (asthma + severity, atopic dermatitis, Aspirin Exacerbated Disease (AERD), chronic allergic rhinitis)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Patient characteristics: Medical history
primaryOutcomes.description: Including CRSwNP history and CRSwNP family history.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Patient characteristics: Lifestyle habits
Disease characteristics: CRSwNP duration
Disease characteristics: Age at diagnosis of CRSwNP
Disease characteristics: Blood Eosinophils
primaryOutcomes.description: The results of the last test carried out before Dupixent® initiation will be used as baseline, as per standard of care, if available.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: Total serum IgE
primaryOutcomes.description: The results of the last test carried out before Dupixent® initiation will be used as baseline, as per standard of care, if available.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: Anatomopathology
primaryOutcomes.description: The results of the last exam carried out before Dupixent® initiation will be used as baseline, as per standard of care, if available.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: Nasal polyps score (NPS) at baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The nasal polyps endoscopic score (NPS) assesses length and distribution of polyps, with a score from 0 to 4 for each nostril, maximum bilateral score of 8 points. Meaning lower (0=no polyp) and higher (4=large polyps).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: Nasal congestion score (NCS) at baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The Nasal congestion score (NCS) was assessed on a scale of 0 to 3, where 0 = no symptoms, 1 = mild symptoms, 2 = moderate symptoms and 3 = severe symptoms, with higher scores indicating more severity.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: Rhinorrhea score (anterior/posterior) at baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The rhinorrhea scores are scored from 0 ('No symptoms') to 3 ('Severe symptoms'). Where 0 = no symptoms, 1 = mild symptoms, 2 = moderate symptoms and 3 = severe symptoms, with higher scores indicating more severity.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: VAS for CRSwNP symptoms at baseline
primaryOutcomes.description:
The Visual Analog Scale for CRSwNP assesses symptoms, ranging from 0 to 10:

* mild if VAS between 0 and 3
* moderate if VAS between \> 3 and 7
* severe if VAS between \> 7 and 10.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Disease characteristics: smell test score Visual Analog Scale (VAS) at baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: Participants value their olfactory function by using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), the range of the VAS was from 0 (not troublesome) to 10 (worse thinkable troublesome), where higher score indicated worse thinkable troublesome.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease: Number of patients with at least one prior or concomitant SCS
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients with at least one prior or concomitant Systemic Corticosteroids (SCS)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease:Type of prior Systemic Corticosteroids (SCS) per patient
Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease: Cumulative dose of SCS
primaryOutcomes.description: Cumulative dose over the past year

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease: Total number of SCS bursts per patient
Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease: Recovery of sense of smell after SCS
primaryOutcomes.description: Recovery of sense of smell after SCS will be described.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease:Time since the most recent SCS burst before initiation of Dupixent®
Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other disease: Number of prior or respiratory concomitant biotherapies per patient
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of prior, resp. concomitant biotherapies per patient

primaryOutcomes.measure: Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other diseases: Indication
Concomitant and prior medications for CRSwNP or other diseases: Reason for stop
primaryOutcomes.description: Reason for stop will be describe.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Dupilumab (Dupixent®) modalities: Dosage
Dupilumab (Dupixent®) modalities: Injection modalities
Dupilumab (Dupixent®) modalities: Treatment duration
Dupilumab (Dupixent®) modalities: Compliance with treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of Nasal polyps score (NPS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The nasal polyps endoscopic score (NPS) assesses length and distribution of polyps, with a score from 0 to 4 for each nostril, maximum bilateral score of 8 points. Meaning lower (0=no polyp) and higher (4=large polyps).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of Nasal congestion score (NCS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Nasal congestion score (NCS) was assessed on a scale of 0 to 3, where 0 = no symptoms, 1 = mild symptoms, 2 = moderate symptoms and 3 = severe symptoms, with higher scores indicating more severity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of Smell test scores UPSIT
secondaryOutcomes.description: The UPSIT (UPSIT 40-odorant test) quantifies human olfactory function. Being the scores: ≤ 18 (anosmia) / \[19-25\] (severe hyposmia) / \[26-30\] (moderate hyposmia) / \[31-34\] (mild hyposmia) / \[35-40\] (normosmia)). A higher score indicating a better function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of smell test score Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participants value their olfactory function by using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS), the range of the VAS was from 0 (not troublesome) to 10 (worse thinkable troublesome), where higher score indicated worse thinkable troublesome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of Quality of life questionnaire for patients with sino nasal symptoms (SNOT22)
secondaryOutcomes.description: SNOT-22 is a patient-reported outcome (PRO) questionnaire. Score ranges from 0 to 110 with higher score indicating greater rhinosinusitis related health burden.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of VAS for CRSwNP symptoms
secondaryOutcomes.description:
The Visual Analog Scale for CRSwNP assesses symptoms, ranging from 0 to 10:

* mild if VAS between 0 and 3
* moderate if VAS between \> 3 and 7
* severe if VAS between \> 7 and 10.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of Rhinorrhea score (anterior/posterior)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The rhinorrhea scores are scored from 0 ('No symptoms') to 3 ('Severe symptoms'). Where 0 = no symptoms, 1 = mild symptoms, 2 = moderate symptoms and 3 = severe symptoms, with higher scores indicating more severity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline of number of SCS bursts/ surgery for CRSwNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rescue therapy: The number of SCS bursts/ surgery for CRSwNP will be reported.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health care resource utilization (HCRU) for CRSwNP
secondaryOutcomes.description: Health care resource utilization may include hospitalizations (including length of stay), outpatient visits, emergency room visits, specific transfusion visits.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sense of smell impairment other than related to CRSwNP (Covid19)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Collection of: Sense of smell impairment other than related to CRSwNP (Covid19) will be reported. If present, an Adverse Event (AE) will be recorded.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Adverse Events (AE) / Serious Adverse Events (SAE)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The number of events and the percentage of patients who had at least one event will be described.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From date of signed ICF or from date of Day 1 whichever comes first, up to 24 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: Site characteristics (University/general Hospital/private clinic) will be described.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient aged \>= 18 years old at the time of the initiation of the treatment with dupilumab (Dupixent®).
* Decision to initiate Dupixent® prior to inclusion in the study, initiation of Dupixent® for severe Chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis (CRSwNP) maximum 3 months before inclusion.
* Informed consent and willingness to participate.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Conditions or legal situations resulting in impossibility to consent or impacting the interpretation of the results.
* Patient participating in an interventional clinical trial with experimental product at inclusion.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with asthma initiating Dupilumab for their Severe chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis (CRSwNP) according to the prescribing information in France.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Qualified researchers may request access to patient level data and related study documents including the clinical study report, study protocol with any amendments, blank case report form, statistical analysis plan, and dataset specifications. Patient level data will be anonymized and study documents will be redacted to protect the privacy of trial participants. Further details on Sanofi's data sharing criteria, eligible studies, and process for requesting access can be found at: https://vivli.org
